results.name: Triangle read by rows: entries give numbers of permutations of [1..n] by absolute barycenter.
comment: The barycenter or signcenter of a permutation is the sum of the signs of the difference between initial and final positions of the objects.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..20, flattened
example: (1,6,2,3,4,5,7) has difference (0,5,-1,-1,-1,-1,0) and signs (0,1,-1,-1,-1,-1,0) with total -3, absolute value is 3. This is one of 268 such permutations of degree 7.
maple: b:= proc(s, t) option remember; (n-> `if`(n=0, x^t,
mathematica: b[s_, t_] := b[s, t] = With[{n = Length[s]}, If[n == 0, x^t, Sum[b[s  ~Complement~ {j}, t + Sign[n - j]], {j, s}]]];
T[n_] := With[{p = b[Range[n], 0]}, Table[Coefficient[p, x, i]*If[i == 0, 1, 2], {i, 0, Exponent[p, x]}]];
Table[T[n], {n, 0, 12}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 25 2021, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
